intro: Porphyranthus, commonly known as the red-flowered spiderwort, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is characterized by its striking, often red or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. The plants typically have slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Porphyranthus species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are often found in moist, shady environments such as forest floors or stream banks.
